title: Why We Need To Abolish Borders
description:
“The border is not just a wall. It’s not just a line on a map. It’s not any particular physical location. It’s a power structure, a system of control. The border is everywhere that people live in fear of deportation, everywhere migrants are denied the rights accorded citizens, everywhere human beings are segregated into included and excluded. The border does not divide one world from another. There is only one world, and the border is tearing it apart.”

The list of artists used is in the outro.

The History of Movement & Borders - 1:56

title: What is Black Existentialism?
description:

I touched on the works of Cornel West, W E B Dubois, Frantz Fanon, and more. Hope you enjoy this little journey of learning!
